definitions.text: the opening through which food is taken in and vocalizations emerge
examples: he stuffed his mouth with candy

definitions.text: the externally visible part of the oral cavity on the face and the system of organs surrounding the opening
examples: she wiped lipstick from her mouth

definitions.text: an opening that resembles a mouth (as of a cave or a gorge)
examples: he rode into the mouth of the canyon
they built a fire at the mouth of the cave

definitions.text: the point where a stream issues into a larger body of water
examples: New York is at the mouth of the Hudson

definitions.text: a person conceived as a consumer of food
examples: he has four mouths to feed
don't give me any of your sass

definitions.text: the opening of a jar or bottle
examples: the jar had a wide mouth
She talks a lot of nonsense
This depressed patient does not verbalize

definitions.text: articulate silently; form words with the lips only
